definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The traditional view is that Regaining Educational Right of the National governments in Nanjing is ostensible.
sentences.chinese: 認爲南京政府收回教育權流於形式的觀點並不準確。

sentences.english: At many companies, the annual meeting is a waste of time because exhibitionists turn it into a sideshow.
sentences.chinese: 在許多公司股東會只是浪費時間，因爲大多流於形式。

sentences.english: But the present jury system of our country has become a mere formality because of all kinds of reasons.
sentences.chinese: 但由於各種原因，當前我國陪審制度已基本流於形式。

sentences.english: These Phenomenon and still formal training is wide spread exist.
sentences.chinese: 爲培訓而培訓，培訓流於形式的現象普遍存在。

sentences.english: In this way, the so-called assets declaration system also too formalistic doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，所謂的財產申報制度也就未免流於形式主義。

definition: to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to pretend that everything is going well
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
